DataElement.preferredName: Patient Infection Personal Medical History Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether the patient's personal medical history includes known infectious diseases.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary. A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. An account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have known curre
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known current or ongoing infectious diseases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have invasive fungal infections?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active uncontrolled infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection including tuberculosis (clinical evaluation that includes clinical history, physical examination, and radiographic findings, and TB testing in line with local practice), hepatitis B (known positive HBV surface antigen (HBsAg) result), or hepatitis C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient currently receiving treatment for HCV infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active uncontrolled infection or severe infectious disease, such as severe pneumonia, meningitis, or septicemia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active, uncontrolled infection as deemed by the treating investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active uncontrolled infection requiring IV antibiotics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active uncontrolled infections or recently received active vaccinations?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active, clinically serious infections greater than grade 2 (CTCAE v5.0) (viral, bacterial or fungal infection)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an ongoing active infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have fungal, bacterial, viral, or other infection that is uncontrolled?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active systemic fungal infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active, uncontrolled infection as determined by the investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a severe infection within the 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment, including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia, or any active infection that could impact patient safety?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection at the time of study entry?
